example.text: Washington, DC – US Representative Mike Doyle (D-PA-18) announced today that his legislation to designate the post office located at 850 Walnut Street in McKeesport, Pennsylvania, as the First Sergeant Leonard A Funk, Jr. Post Office Building has been approved by both the House and Senate and will be sent to the White House for the President’s signature. This bill, HR 5794, was passed by the House of Representatives on July 12, 2022, by a voice vote and passed by the Senate yesterday.

“These investments will create jobs in Allegheny County, make us healthier, and strengthen our communities.” The funding included in HR 2617 for Pennsylvania’s 18th Congressional District consist of: $750,000 for ACTION-Housing to build affordable housing on the Westinghouse Atom Smasher Site $3,234,170 for ALCOSAN to reduce sewer overflows into local waterways $4,000,000 for Braddock Carnegie Library restoration $750,000 for Carnegie Library of Homestead renovation $750,000 for the City of Clairton to develop a Community Center $1,000,000 for the City of Pittsburgh to provide overdose support services to residents $7,000,000 for the City of Pittsburgh to renovate 10 sets of city steps $2,200,000 for Duquesne University for construction of a new College of Osteopathic Medicine $635,392 for Innovation Works, Inc. for its On-Ramps to Entrepreneurship program $3,000,000 for the Pittsburgh Film Office for its Carrie Film Furnace project $5,000,000 for Pittsburgh Regional Transit for renovation of the Station Square transit station $2,200,000 for Primary Care Health Services, Inc. for construction of its new health center $500,000 for the Rivers of Steel Heritage Corporation for the preservation of Carrie Furnaces $750,000 for the URA of Pittsburgh for the revitalization of Homewood Avenue $2,000,000 for Veterans Place of Washington Boulevard for housing for homeless vets The government funding package will create good-paying American jobs, grow opportunity for the middle class and small businesses, and provide a lifeline for working families. Click here for a detailed summary of the bill.

“I’m grateful to the McKeesport community members who suggested renaming the post office after him, I’m indebted to Senator Casey for shepherding this legislation through the Senate, and I’m proud to be able to help make this small gesture of our nation’s respect and appreciation possible.” ###
